titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Glen Cooper Henshaw Record Book, circa 1911-circa 1945, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Rihoko Ueno

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:07:38 -0400.

did.abstract: The Glen Cooper Henshaw record book is an undated record book of 163 of Henshaw's paintings. Each painting in the record book has a snapshot and lists the dimensions, title, medium and color.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Due to the small size of this collection this papers are arranged as one series.

list.item: Series 1: Glen Cooper Henshaw record book, circa 1911-circa 1945 (Folder 1; 1 item)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Glen Cooper Henshaw (1885-1946) was a painter who was primarily based in New York City. Henshaw was born in Windfall, Indiana, and he went on to live and work in Paris, London, Baltimore and New York. He returned in Indiana 1941, where he continued to paint until his death in 1946.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Access to original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C. Research Center.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: The collection is available on 35mm microfilm reel 1110 at the Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Glen Cooper Henshaw record book was donated to the Archives of American Art in 1973 by Russell Burke, an auctioneer.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Glen Cooper Henshaw record book, circa 1911-circa 1945. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed, and a finding aid prepared by Rihoko Ueno in 2021.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Glen Cooper Henshaw record book is an undated record book of 163 of Henshaw's paintings. Each painting in the record book has a snapshot and lists the dimensions, title, medium and color.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: A monograph, Glen Cooper Henshaw, by Louise Henshaw and Warren Wilmer Brown (The Monumental Press, Baltimore, MD: 1945) filmed on reel 1110 was transferred from this collection to the Smithsonian American Art and Portrait Gallery Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Glen Cooper Henshaw record book is an undated record book of 163 of Henshaw's paintings. Each painting in the record book has a snapshot and lists the dimensions, title, medium and color.
